title: Georgia House - Day 35 (2026-03-25)
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the Georgia House session transcript from 2026-03-25:

## Overview
The session focused on a call for unity and peacemaking among the representatives, with the chaplain emphasizing the importance of characteristics like being like-minded, sympathetic, loving one another, and acting with humility. There were no major legislative actions taken.

## Key Actions
No significant bills were passed or referred during this session.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
No new bills were introduced.

## Notable Moments
- The chaplain, Reverend Chip Gordon, gave a speech emphasizing the importance of unity, peace, and characteristics like being sympathetic and humble. 
- Representative Smith introduced Reverend Gordon and provided background on his experience in pastoral care and community service.

## Votes
No recorded votes took place.

## Attendance
A quorum was present, with all members voting to signify their attendance.

## Adjournment
The session was adjourned. The next session date was not specified.
